page.title: 04Farming in Colden Common
page.content: The Chalk areas,in the main,have well drained soils.They are used for arable farming,predominantly barley with oil seed rape grown as a break crop. However,the importance of dairying is illustrated by the presence of grassland in this area,particularly on the steeper slopes such as the dry valley containing Hensting. The relatively heavy soils of the Tertiary clays are mainly in grassland,again supporting dairying. Woodland is relatively extensive in the block.Almost all is deciduous and, in places,shows evidence of coppicing. There is little indication of any intensive present-day management. A small trout-farm exists at Fishers Pond providing a link with the medieval fishponds in the area.
